content.description:
Scientists studied the marsupial population in South America to determine species relatedness. The hypothetical relationships are presented in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Â Simplified cladogram of marsupial species in South America
content.question: Which of the following best explains the relationships illustrated in Figure 1?

choices.label: The gray short-tailed opossum is more closely related to the Andean shrew opossum than to the other opossum species.
The rat opossum and the gray short-tailed opossum share a more recent common ancestor than the rat opossum and the Andean shrew opossum do.
The Andean shrew opossum and the rat opossum form a separate branch from the other opossum species.
The four-eyed opossum and the woolly opossum are more distantly related to each other than to the big-eared opossum.

content.answer: The Andean shrew opossum and the rat opossum form a separate branch from the other opossum species.
